Package com.taco.suit_lady.util.timing

Class Timer

java.lang.Object
com.taco.suit_lady.util.timing.Timer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Timeable
public class Timer extends Object implements Timeable
Allows for the creation of various countdown timers. To create a new Timer object, refer to the Timers class.
See Also:
Timers

  • Constructor Details

    • Timer

      protected Timer​(Number timeout, Runnable onTimeout)
      Constructs a new timer with the specified timeout (ms) and timeout action.
      Parameters:
      timeout - The timeout. In milliseconds.
      onTimeout - A Runnable that is executed when the timer times out. Null for no action.
      See Also:
      Timers

  • Method Details

    • timeoutProperty

      public final javafx.beans.property.ReadOnlyLongProperty timeoutProperty()
      Returns the timeout property for this timer.
      See Also:
      getTimeout(), setTimeout(Number)

    • getTimeout

      public final long getTimeout()
      Returns the timeout of the timer.
      Returns:
      The timeout.

    • setTimeout

      public final void setTimeout​(Number timeout)
      Sets the timeout of the timer to be equal to the specified timeout.
      Parameters:
      timeout - The timeout. Any number less than 0 will result in no timeout being used.

    • isStarted

      public final boolean isStarted()
      Checks to see if the timer has been started or not.

      This method differs from isStopped() in that this method will return true if this method has ever been started, regardless if the timer is currently stopped.

      Returns:
      True if the timer has been started, false otherwise.

    • isStopped

      public final boolean isStopped()
      Checks to see if the timer is stopped or not.

      This method differs from isStarted() in that this method will return true even if the timer has been previously started.

      Returns:
      True if the timer is stopped, false otherwise.

    • onTimeoutProperty

      public final javafx.beans.property.ReadOnlyObjectProperty<Runnable> onTimeoutProperty()
      See Also:
      getOnTimeout(), setOnTimeout(Runnable)

      public final Runnable getOnTimeout()
      Gets the value of the property onTimeout.

      public final void setOnTimeout​(Runnable onTimeout)
      Sets the value of the property onTimeout.
      Property description:

    • getStartTime

      public final long getStartTime()
      Gets the start time of the timer.
      Specified by:
      getStartTime in interface Timeable
      Returns:
      The start time. 0 if the timer has not yet been started.

    • getElapsedTime

      public final long getElapsedTime()
      Gets the time that has elapsed since the start of the timer.
      Specified by:
      getElapsedTime in interface Timeable
      Returns:
      The time that has elapsed since the start of the timer.

    • getRemainingTime

      public final long getRemainingTime()
      Gets the time left before the timer times out.

      If this timer is not using a timeout, Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY is returned.

      Returns:
      The amount of milliseconds before the timer times out.

    • isTimedOut

      public final boolean isTimedOut()
      Checks to see whether or not the timer has timed out.
      Returns:
      True if the timer has timed out, false otherwise.

    • start

      public final void start()
      Starts this timer.
      Specified by:
      start in interface Timeable

    • startAndGet

      public final Timer startAndGet()
      Starts and then returns this timer.
      Specified by:
      startAndGet in interface Timeable
      Returns:
      This timer.

    • start

      public final void start​(Number newTimeout)
      Starts this timer, setting the timer's timeout to the given value.
      Parameters:
      newTimeout - The new timeout for this timer. -1 to start the timer without changing the timeout.

    • reset

      public final void reset()
      Resets the timer. Calling this method has no effect if the timer has not yet been started.
      Specified by:
      reset in interface Timeable

    • reset

      public final void reset​(Number newTimeout)
      Resets this timer, setting the timer's timeout to the given value.
      Parameters:
      newTimeout - The new timeout for this timer. -1 to not change the timeout. Cannot be less than -1.

    • stop

      public final void stop()
      Stops this timer.
      Specified by:
      stop in interface Timeable
